I’ve got a new hire coming for the first time in a long while so I thought it was time to put on by gray beard and pontificate for a while. Here goes:

  1. Learn your boss’ technical weaknesses.
  2. There’s a reason for everything.
  3. Don’t re-invent the world.
  4. Refactor Wisely
  5. Gems are dangerous.
  6. Codebases are living things.
  7. Pair Program Regularly
  8. Monitor Everything
  9. Code reviews are a myth
  10. Never release major changes on a thursday or friday.
  11. Never work more than 40 hours per week.
  12. You likely aren’t as smart as you think you are.

Each is discussed more below.
